top_categories.workout_context: 100ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
8,000ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
Gravel Bogotá's Colombian mountains, South American gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 80 miles.
At Gravel Bogotá, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Gravel Bogotá's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before race day.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gravel Bogotá. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 80, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 80 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
8,000ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Gravel Bogotá, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 80 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on colombian mountain gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gravel Bogotá’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Gravel Bogotá with 8,000ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. High altitude.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gravel Bogotá requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on colombian mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: colombian mountains, south american gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, VO2max, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 80 miles of colombian mountain gravel in Bogotá, Colombia.
